name: Atlanta Hawks
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Atlanta, the franchise's origins trace to the establishment of the Buffalo Bisons in 1946. The team has since been based in Moline, Illinois (as the Tri-Cities Blackhawks), Milwaukee, and St. Louis, where they won their only NBA Championship in 1958, before relocating to Atlanta in 1968."

name: Boston Celtics
description: "Based in Boston, the Celtics are one of the NBA's original franchises, founded in 1946. They are regarded as one of the most successful teams in league history, holding the record for the most NBA Championships with 18 titles. The team's historic rivalry with the Los Angeles Lakers is a cornerstone of NBA lore."

name: Brooklyn Nets
description: "Established in 1967 as the New Jersey Americans, a charter franchise of the American Basketball Association (ABA). The team became the New York Nets and won two ABA championships in 1974 and 1976, led by Hall of Famer Julius Erving. After the ABA-NBA merger, they moved back to New Jersey, playing as the New Jersey Nets from 1977 to 2012 before relocating to Brooklyn."

name: Charlotte Hornets
description: "An American professional team based in Charlotte, North Carolina. The original Hornets franchise was established in 1988 but relocated to New Orleans in 2002. The league returned to Charlotte in 2004 with the expansion Charlotte Bobcats. In 2014, the Bobcats were renamed the Hornets and acquired the history and records of the original 1988–2002 Charlotte team."

name: Chicago Bulls
description: "Founded in 1966, the Chicago Bulls are a professional basketball team based in Chicago. The franchise is famed for its dynasty in the 1990s, when, led by Michael Jordan and Scottie Pippen, they won six NBA championships. The Bulls are the only NBA franchise to win multiple titles while never losing an NBA Finals series."

name: Cleveland Cavaliers
description: "Based in Cleveland, Ohio, the Cavaliers joined the NBA in 1970 as an expansion team. The franchise's most successful period came with the drafting of LeBron James, who led the team to its first NBA Finals appearance in 2007 and its first and only NBA championship in 2016."

name: Dallas Mavericks
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Dallas, Texas, founded in 1980. After a period of success in the 1980s, the franchise was defined by the career of Dirk Nowitzki, who led the team to its only NBA championship in 2011. The team has won three conference championships."

name: Denver Nuggets
description: "Based in Denver, Colorado, the franchise was founded as the Denver Larks in 1967 as a charter member of the American Basketball Association (ABA), but was renamed the Rockets before its first season. The team was renamed the Nuggets in 1974 and joined the NBA in 1976 during the ABA-NBA merger. The team won its first NBA championship in 2023."

name: Detroit Pistons
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Detroit. The franchise was founded in 1937 as the Fort Wayne Zollner Pistons, a semi-professional team that turned professional in 1941. After joining the NBA, the team relocated to Detroit in 1957. The Pistons have won three NBA championships (1989, 1990, 2004)."

name: Golden State Warriors
description: "Founded in 1946 as the Philadelphia Warriors, a charter member of the Basketball Association of America (BAA). The team moved to the San Francisco Bay Area in 1962 and became the Golden State Warriors in 1971. The franchise has won seven championships, including the inaugural BAA championship in 1947 and four titles in the 21st century."

name: Houston Rockets
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Houston, Texas. The franchise was established in 1967 as the San Diego Rockets, an expansion team. The team relocated to Houston in 1971. The Rockets won back-to-back NBA championships in 1994 and 1995, led by Hall of Fame center Hakeem Olajuwon."

name: Indiana Pacers
description: "Based in Indianapolis, Indiana, the Pacers were founded in 1967 as a charter member of the American Basketball Association (ABA). They were a dominant force in the ABA, winning three championships. The Pacers joined the NBA in 1976 as part of the merger and reached the NBA Finals in 2000."

name: Los Angeles Clippers
description: "An American professional team based in the Los Angeles area. The franchise was founded in 1970 as the Buffalo Braves. It relocated to San Diego in 1978, becoming the Clippers, before moving to Los Angeles in 1984. The franchise has won three division titles."

name: Los Angeles Lakers
description: "One of the most successful teams in NBA history, the Lakers franchise began in 1946 as the Detroit Gems of the NBL. The team relocated to Minneapolis in 1947, becoming the Minneapolis Lakers and winning five championships before moving to Los Angeles in 1960. The Lakers have won 17 NBA championships in total, tied for the most in league history."

name: Memphis Grizzlies
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Memphis, Tennessee. The franchise was established in 1995 as the Vancouver Grizzlies, as part of the NBA's expansion into Canada. The team relocated to Memphis in 2001. The Grizzlies have won two division titles."

name: Miami Heat
description: "Based in Miami, Florida, the Heat joined the NBA in 1988 as an expansion team. The franchise has won three NBA championships (2006, 2012, 2013) and has made seven NBA Finals appearances, establishing itself as a perennial contender in the Eastern Conference."

name: Milwaukee Bucks
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, founded in 1968 as an expansion team. The Bucks won their first NBA championship in 1971, led by Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Oscar Robertson. They won their second title 50 years later in 2021, led by Giannis Antetokounmpo."

name: Minnesota Timberwolves
description: "Based in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the Timberwolves joined the NBA in 1989 as an expansion team. The franchise's most successful period was in the late 1990s and early 2000s, led by Kevin Garnett, culminating in a Western Conference Finals appearance in 2004."

name: New Orleans Pelicans
description: "An American professional basketball team based in New Orleans, Louisiana. The franchise was established as the New Orleans Hornets in 2002 following the relocation of the original Charlotte Hornets. The team was renamed the Pelicans in 2013. They have won one division title."

name: New York Knicks
description: "Based in Manhattan, New York City, the Knicks are one of the two original NBA teams still located in their founding city. Established in 1946 as a charter member of the BAA, the Knicks have won two NBA championships (1970, 1973) and have a storied history at their home court, Madison Square Garden."

name: Oklahoma City Thunder
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Oklahoma City. The franchise was originally established as the Seattle SuperSonics in 1967, winning an NBA championship in 1979. The team relocated to Oklahoma City in 2008 and was renamed the Thunder. They reached the NBA Finals in 2012."

name: Orlando Magic
description: "Based in Orlando, Florida, the Magic joined the NBA in 1989 as an expansion franchise. The team has reached the NBA Finals twice, in 1995 with Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway, and in 2009 with Dwight Howard. The franchise has won seven division titles."

name: Philadelphia 76ers
description: "One of the oldest franchises in the NBA, the team was founded in 1946 as the Syracuse Nationals in the NBL. They relocated to Philadelphia in 1963, becoming the 76ers. The franchise has won three NBA championships, one as the Nationals in 1955, and two as the 76ers in 1967 and 1983."

name: Phoenix Suns
description: "Based in Phoenix, Arizona, the Suns joined the NBA in 1968 as an expansion team. They have the highest all-time winning percentage of any team to have never won an NBA championship. The Suns have made three NBA Finals appearances (1976, 1993, 2021) and have won eight division titles."

name: Portland Trail Blazers
description: "An American professional basketball team based in Portland, Oregon, founded in 1970 as an expansion team. The Trail Blazers won the NBA championship in 1977, led by Bill Walton. The team has made two other NBA Finals appearances in 1990 and 1992."

name: Sacramento Kings
description: "The oldest franchise in the NBA, the team's history began in 1923 as the semi-professional Rochester Seagrams. The franchise joined the NBL in 1945 as the Rochester Royals, winning an NBL title in 1946 and an NBA title in 1951. After stints in Cincinnati and Kansas City, the team moved to Sacramento in 1985."

name: San Antonio Spurs
description: "Based in San Antonio, Texas, the franchise was founded in 1967 as the Dallas Chaparrals of the ABA. The team moved to San Antonio in 1973 and was renamed the Spurs before joining the NBA in the 1976 merger. The Spurs have won five NBA championships (1999, 2003, 2005, 2007, 2014)."

name: Toronto Raptors
description: "A Canadian professional basketball team based in Toronto, founded in 1995 as part of the NBA's expansion into Canada. Since the 2001–02 season, the Raptors have been the only Canadian team in the league. They won their first NBA championship in 2019."

name: Utah Jazz
description: "Based in Salt Lake City, the franchise began play in 1974 as the New Orleans Jazz, an expansion team. The team relocated to Utah in 1979. The Jazz are known for the Hall of Fame duo of John Stockton and Karl Malone, who led the team to two NBA Finals appearances in 1997 and 1998."

name: Washington Wizards
description: "Based in Washington, D.C., the franchise was established in 1961 as the Chicago Packers, the NBA's first expansion team. After one season, they became the Chicago Zephyrs, then moved to become the Baltimore Bullets, Capital Bullets, and Washington Bullets before rebranding as the Wizards in 1997. The franchise won the NBA championship in 1978."

name: Anadolu Efes
description: "A Turkish professional basketball team based in Istanbul. Founded in 1976, it is the most successful club in the history of the Turkish Super League (BSL) with 16 championships. The club has also achieved significant European success, winning back-to-back EuroLeague titles in 2021 and 2022."

name: Baskonia
description: "A professional basketball team based in Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain. Founded in 1959, the club competes in the Liga ACB and the EuroLeague. Baskonia has won four Spanish championships and is known for its strong record of developing elite international and NBA-level talent."

name: FC Barcelona Bàsquet
description: "The professional basketball team of the FC Barcelona multi-sports club, based in Barcelona, Spain. Founded in 1926, it is the oldest club in the Liga ACB. Barça is one of the most successful teams in Europe, having won two EuroLeague titles and completing a Triple Crown in 2003."

name: Fenerbahçe Basketball
description: "The men's basketball department of Fenerbahçe S.K., a major Turkish multi-sport club based in Istanbul. The basketball section was founded in 1913. The team became the first Turkish club to win the EuroLeague in 2017 and is a dominant force in the Turkish Basketball Super League."

name: Maccabi Tel Aviv B.C.
description: "A professional basketball club based in Tel Aviv, Israel. Founded in 1932, it is the most successful team in Israeli basketball history, with 57 Israeli championships. Maccabi is also a European powerhouse, having won 6 EuroLeague championships."

name: Olimpia Milano
description: "An Italian professional basketball team based in Milan. Founded in 1930, it is the most successful club in Italy, with 31 Italian League championships. Known for its red and white colors and the nickname ""Scarpette Rosse"" (Little Red Shoes), the club has also won 3 EuroLeague titles."

name: Olympiacos B.C.
description: "A Greek professional basketball club based in Piraeus, part of the Olympiacos CFP multi-sport club. The basketball department was established in 1931. Olympiacos is a major European power, having won 3 EuroLeague titles and being the only Greek club to win back-to-back European championships."

name: Panathinaikos B.C.
description: "The professional basketball team of the Panathinaikos A.O. multi-sport club in Athens, Greece. The basketball section was founded in 1919, making it one of the oldest in the country. Panathinaikos is the most successful club in Greek basketball history and one of the most successful in Europe, with 7 EuroLeague championships."

name: Real Madrid Baloncesto
description: "The professional basketball section of the Real Madrid CF multi-sport club, based in Madrid, Spain. Founded in 1931, it is arguably the most successful basketball club in European history, having won a record 11 EuroLeague championships and a record 38 Spanish League titles."

name: ASVEL Basket
description: "A French professional basketball team based in Villeurbanne, a suburb of Lyon. Founded in 1948, the club is the most successful in French basketball history, with 21 LNB Élite championships. The club's president is former NBA star Tony Parker."

name: FC Bayern Munich (basketball)
description: "The basketball section of the FC Bayern Munich sports club, based in Munich, Germany. Founded in 1946, the team competes in the Basketball Bundesliga (BBL) and the EuroLeague. After a period of obscurity, the club experienced a resurgence in the 2010s and has since become a German powerhouse, winning six national championships."

name: Žalgiris Kaunas
description: "A professional basketball club based in Kaunas, Lithuania. Founded in 1944, Žalgiris is the most decorated basketball club in the country, with 25 Lithuanian championships. The club won the EuroLeague championship in 1999 and is a symbol of Lithuanian national identity."

name: CSKA Moscow (basketball)
description: "A Russian professional basketball team based in Moscow, founded in 1923. It is the most successful basketball team in Russian and Soviet history, with 8 EuroLeague championships and numerous domestic titles. The club is currently suspended from EuroLeague competition."

name: Valencia Basket
description: "A professional basketball team based in Valencia, Spain. Founded in 1986, the club competes in the Liga ACB and EuroLeague. Valencia has won the EuroCup a record four times and won its first Spanish League championship in 2017."

name: Virtus Bologna
description: "An Italian professional basketball club from Bologna, founded in 1927. Known as the ""Black V's,"" Virtus is one of Italy's most titled clubs, with seventeen national championships, two EuroLeague titles, and a EuroCup title. They have a historic rivalry with the city's other team, Fortitudo Bologna."

name: Crvena zvezda (basketball)
description: "A men's professional basketball club based in Belgrade, Serbia, part of the Red Star multi-sports club. Founded in 1945, it is one of the most successful clubs in Serbia, with 24 national league championships and a FIBA Saporta Cup title in 1974. The club has a fierce rivalry with Partizan."

name: Partizan Belgrade basketball
description: "A professional basketball club based in Belgrade, Serbia, part of the Partizan multi-sports club. Founded in 1945, the team has won 22 national championships and 8 Adriatic League titles. Their most notable achievement is winning the EuroLeague championship in 1992."

name: AS Monaco Basket
description: "A French-registered, Monaco-based professional basketball club founded in 1928. A part of the A.S. Monaco multi-sports club, the team plays in the French LNB Élite and the EuroLeague. They won their first EuroCup title in 2021 and have become a major force in European basketball."

name: Paris Basketball
description: "A French professional basketball club based in Paris, founded in 2018. The club rapidly ascended to the top tier LNB Élite and made its EuroLeague debut in the 2024-25 season after winning the 2023–24 EuroCup title."

name: Bamberg Baskets
description: "A German professional basketball team from Bamberg, Bavaria. Founded in 1955, the club has won the German Championship nine times and the German Cup six times. Known for its passionate fan base, the team competes in the Basketball Bundesliga (BBL)."

name: Ratiopharm Ulm
description: "A German professional basketball club based in Ulm, Germany. Founded in 2001, the team plays in the Basketball Bundesliga (BBL). They won their first-ever national championship in 2023 as the seventh seed, the lowest seed ever to win the title."

name: Riesen Ludwigsburg
description: "A professional basketball club based in Ludwigsburg, Germany. Founded in 1960, the club has been a regular in the top-tier Basketball Bundesliga (BBL) since the 1986–87 season. They reached the German finals for the first time in 2020."

name: Telekom Baskets Bonn
description: "A German professional basketball club based in Bonn, Germany. Founded in 1992, the team plays in the Basketball Bundesliga (BBL). In 2023, the Baskets won the Basketball Champions League, the club's first-ever major title."

name: Unicaja
description: "A professional basketball club based in Málaga, Spain. Originally founded in 1977 as CB Caja de Ronda, the club merged with CB Maristas de Málaga in 1992. Unicaja has won one Spanish League title (2006), one EuroCup (2017), and two Basketball Champions League titles (2024, 2025)."

name: Beijing Ducks
description: "A professional basketball team based in Beijing, China, playing in the Chinese Basketball Association (CBA). The club was formed in 1956 and became a professional team in 1995. The Ducks won three CBA championships in four years between 2012 and 2015, led by former NBA All-Star Stephon Marbury."

name: Liaoning Flying Leopards
description: "A professional basketball team based in Shenyang, Liaoning, China. The club's history dates to 1953, and it became a founding member of the CBA in 1995. The Flying Leopards are a dominant force in the CBA, having won four championships, including three consecutive titles from 2022 to 2024."

name: Guangdong Southern Tigers
description: "A Chinese professional basketball team based in Dongguan, Guangdong. Established in 1993, it is the most successful team in CBA history, having won a record 11 championships. The Tigers are the only team to have qualified for the CBA playoffs every season since the league's inception."

name: Xinjiang Flying Tigers
description: "A professional basketball team based in Ürümqi, Xinjiang, China. The club joined the CBA in 1999 and has been a perennial contender, making six finals appearances. The Flying Tigers won their first CBA championship in the 2016–17 season."

name: Shanghai Sharks
description: "A professional basketball team based in Shanghai, China, founded in 1996. The Sharks are best known internationally as the team that developed Hall of Famer Yao Ming. With Yao, the team made three consecutive CBA Finals, winning the championship in 2002."

name: Zhejiang Lions
description: "A Chinese professional basketball team based in Hangzhou, Zhejiang. Founded in 2005, the team is also known as the Zhejiang Guangsha Lions. They have been runners-up in the CBA Finals twice, in 2018 and 2022, and won their first championship in 2025."

name: Shenzhen Leopards
description: "A Chinese professional basketball team based in Shenzhen, Guangdong. Founded in 2003 as the Dongguan New Century Leopards, the team relocated to Shenzhen in 2015. The team has been a regular participant in the CBA playoffs."

name: Shandong Hi-Speed Kirin
description: "A professional basketball team based in Jinan, Shandong, China. Founded in 1995, the team has gone through several names, including the Flaming Bulls and Heroes. Their most successful season was in 2012–13, when they reached the CBA Finals."

name: Jilin Northeast Tigers
description: "A professional basketball team based in Changchun, Jilin, China. The team was founded in 1956 and became a professional club in 1998. The team's mascot is a Siberian tiger, reflecting the region's geography."

name: Shanxi Loongs
description: "A Chinese professional basketball team based in Taiyuan, Shanxi. Founded in 2001, the team was known as the Brave Dragons until 2018. The team's name, Loongs, is the Chinese word for dragon, which is also the team's mascot."

name: Barangay Ginebra San Miguel
description: "A professional basketball team in the Philippine Basketball Association (PBA), founded in 1979. Owned by Ginebra San Miguel, Inc., it is widely regarded as the most popular team in the league, known for its ""Never Say Die"" spirit. The team has won 15 PBA championships."

name: San Miguel Beermen
description: "The most successful team in the history of the Philippine Basketball Association (PBA), with a record 30 championships. The Beermen are the only remaining original franchise from the league's inception in 1975. They completed a rare Grand Slam in 1989."

name: Magnolia Hotshots
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, founded in 1988. Owned by San Miguel Food and Beverage, the franchise is most famous for its original name, Purefoods. The team has won 14 PBA titles and is the fourth team in league history to win a Grand Slam (2014)."

name: TNT Tropang Giga
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, founded in 1990. Owned by Smart Communications, the team has played under various names, including Pepsi and Talk 'N Text. The franchise has won 11 official PBA titles and is considered one of the league's modern powerhouses."

name: Meralco Bolts
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, founded in 2010 after the Manila Electric Company (MERALCO) acquired the franchise of the Sta. Lucia Realtors. The team won its first PBA championship in the 2024 Philippine Cup."

name: Rain or Shine Elasto Painters
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, owned by Asian Coatings Philippines, Inc. The team joined the league in 2006 after a successful stint in the amateur Philippine Basketball League. The Elasto Painters have won two PBA championships (2012, 2016)."

name: NLEX Road Warriors
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, owned by NLEX Corporation. The franchise transferred to the PBA in 2014 after dominating the PBA D-League, where it won six championships. The team is one of three PBA teams controlled by businessman Manuel V. Pangilinan."

name: Phoenix Super LPG Fuel Masters
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA owned by Phoenix Petroleum Philippines, Inc. The franchise debuted in 2016 after acquiring the Barako Bull Energy franchise. The team is known for its fast-paced style of play."

name: Blackwater Bossing
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, owned by Ever Bilena Cosmetics, Inc. The franchise joined the PBA in 2014 as an expansion team after a successful run in the PBA D-League. The team is named after the company's brand of men's fragrances."

name: Terrafirma Dyip
description: "A professional basketball team in the PBA, owned by Terrafirma Realty Development Corporation. The franchise joined the league in 2014 as an expansion team and has played under several brand names, including Kia, Mahindra, and Columbian, before adopting its current name."

name: Utsunomiya Brex
description: "A Japanese professional basketball team based in Utsunomiya, Tochigi Prefecture. Founded in 2007, the team competes in the B.League. The name ""Brex"" is a portmanteau of ""Breakthrough"" and the Latin word ""Rex"" (king). The team has won three B.League championships."

name: Ryukyu Golden Kings
description: "A Japanese professional basketball team based in Okinawa. Founded in 2007, the team competes in the B.League. The Golden Kings are one of the most successful teams in Japanese basketball history, having won four titles in the precursor bj league and one B.League championship in 2023."

name: Alvark Tokyo
description: "A Japanese professional basketball team based in Tokyo. Sponsored by Toyota, the club was founded in 1948 as the Toyota Pacers. The team has been the reigning back-to-back champion of the B.League and has a long history of success in Japanese basketball."

name: Chiba Jets Funabashi
description: "A Japanese professional basketball team located in Funabashi, Chiba. Founded in 2005, the team competes in the B.League, which they won in 2021. The team has also won five Emperor's Cups and two East Asia Super League titles."

name: Kawasaki Brave Thunders
description: "A professional basketball team based in Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Japan. Founded in 1950, the team competes in the B.League. They were the champions of the final season of the National Basketball League (NBL) in 2016 before the formation of the B.League."

name: Adelaide 36ers
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Adelaide, South Australia. The club joined the NBL in 1982 as the Adelaide City Eagles before rebranding to the 36ers in 1983, a name reflecting the 1836 founding of the colony of South Australia. The 36ers have won four NBL championships."

name: Brisbane Bullets
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Brisbane, Queensland. The Bullets are one of the NBL's foundation teams from its inaugural 1979 season. The team has won three NBL championships (1985, 1987, 2007) and has a historic rivalry with the Adelaide 36ers."

name: Cairns Taipans
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Cairns, Queensland. Founded in 1999, the Taipans are known for their passionate home crowd at the Cairns Convention Centre, nicknamed ""The Snakepit"". They have reached the NBL Grand Final twice (2011, 2015) but have yet to win a championship."

name: Illawarra Hawks
description: "Based in Wollongong, New South Wales, the Illawarra Hawks are the only remaining foundation club to have competed in every NBL season since 1979. The team won its first NBL championship in 2001 and its second in 2025."

name: Melbourne United
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Melbourne, Victoria. The franchise debuted in the NBL in 1984 as the Melbourne Tigers and was rebranded as Melbourne United in 2014. The club has won six NBL championships, the second-most in league history."

name: New Zealand Breakers
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Auckland. The Breakers are the only non-Australian team in the NBL. Founded in 2003, they have won four NBL championships, including a historic three-peat from 2011 to 2013."

name: Perth Wildcats
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Perth, Western Australia. Founded in 1982, the Wildcats are the most successful team in NBL history, having won a record 10 championships. They hold a league-record streak of 35 consecutive playoff appearances from 1987 to 2021."

name: South East Melbourne Phoenix
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in south-eastern Melbourne. The Phoenix entered the NBL as an expansion team in the 2019–20 season. The team plays its home games at John Cain Arena, known as ""The Fire Pit"" during their games."

name: Sydney Kings
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Sydney, New South Wales. Formed in 1987 from a merger of two existing Sydney teams, the Kings have won five NBL championships. They were the first team in league history to win three consecutive titles (2003-2005)."

name: Tasmania JackJumpers
description: "An Australian professional basketball team based in Hobart, Tasmania. The JackJumpers entered the NBL in the 2021–22 season and reached the Grand Final in their inaugural year. They won their maiden NBL championship in 2024."

name: Auckland Tuatara (basketball)
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Auckland. The franchise was founded in 2018 in Tasmania as the Southern Huskies before relocating to Auckland in 2020. The team competes in the New Zealand NBL and reached the league final in 2022."

name: Canterbury Rams
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Christchurch. The Rams were a foundation member of the NZNBL in 1982. The club has won six championships, including titles in 1986, 1989, 1990, 1992, 2023, and 2024."

name: Franklin Bulls
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Pukekohe. The Bulls were founded in November 2019 and compete in the New Zealand NBL, playing their home games at the Franklin Pool and Leisure Centre, known as ""The Stockyard""."

name: Hawke's Bay Hawks
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Napier. The franchise began in 1983 as the Napier Sunhawks. The Hawks have made eight NBL Grand Final appearances and won their maiden championship in 2006."

name: Manawatu Jets
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Palmerston North. The Jets were a foundation member of the NZNBL in 1982. The team has reached the NBL final twice (1992, 2020) but has not yet won a championship."

name: Nelson Giants
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Nelson. The Giants are the only remaining original team from the NZNBL's inaugural 1982 season. The club has won three championships (1994, 1998, 2007)."

name: Otago Nuggets
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Dunedin. The Nuggets entered the NZNBL in 1990. After a hiatus, the team returned in 2020 and won their maiden NBL championship in the revised season format. They won a second title in 2022."

name: Southland Sharks
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Invercargill. Founded in 2009, the Sharks joined the NZNBL for the 2010 season. The team has won three NBL championships (2013, 2015, 2018)."

name: Taranaki Airs
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in New Plymouth. The franchise began in 1981 and has played under numerous names, including the Bulls, Bears, and Mountainairs. The team was crowned regular season winners in 1992 and 2022."

name: Wellington Saints
description: "A New Zealand professional basketball team based in Wellington. Founded in 1981, the Saints are the most successful team in NZNBL history, having won a record 13 championships. They are known for their consistent competitiveness and strong franchise history."

name: APR
description: "Armée Patriotique Rwandaise Basketball Club, based in Kigali, Rwanda. Founded in 1993 and owned by the Ministry of Defence, APR is the most decorated team in Rwanda with a record 16 national championships. They made their BAL debut in 2024 and finished in third place in the 2025 season."

name: ASC Ville de Dakar
description: "A Senegalese basketball club based in Dakar. The men's team was founded in 2014 within the multi-sport club established in 1980. They won back-to-back national championships in 2024 and 2025 to qualify for the Basketball Africa League."

name: Al Ittihad Alexandria
description: "An Egyptian professional basketball club based in Alexandria. Founded in 1914, it is considered the basketball powerhouse of Egypt, having won a record 16 Premier League titles. They also won the FIBA Africa Champions Cup in 1987 and a record 7 Arab Championships."

name: Al Ahly Ly
description: "A Libyan basketball club based in Benghazi, founded in 1950. The club has won four Libyan championships. They were the runners-up of the 2024 BAL season, becoming the first Libyan team to play in the competition."

name: FUS Rabat
description: "A Moroccan basketball club based in Rabat, founded in 1946. FUS is the most successful club in Moroccan history, with a record 20 national titles. They made their debut in the Basketball Africa League in 2024, winning the inaugural Kalahari Conference."

name: Kriol Star
description: "A Cape Verdean professional basketball team based in Praia. Established in 2024 by professional players Joel and Ivan Almeida, they became the first club from Cape Verde to qualify for and compete in the Basketball Africa League during the 2025 season."

name: Cape Town Tigers
description: "A South African professional basketball team based in Cape Town. Founded in 2019, the Tigers have won three South African national championships and have participated in three seasons of the Basketball Africa League, finishing in fourth place in 2024."

name: Nairobi City Thunder
description: "A Kenyan professional basketball team based in Nairobi. Founded in 1998, the team has won three national titles. After winning the 2024 KBF Premier League, they qualified for the 2025 BAL season, becoming the first Kenyan team to play in the league."

name: Petro de Luanda
description: "An Angolan basketball club based in Luanda, founded in 1980. One of the most successful teams in Angola, Petro has won 16 national championships. They are a powerhouse in continental basketball, winning the BAL in 2024 and the FIBA Africa Champions Cup twice (2006, 2015)."

name: Rivers Hoopers
description: "A Nigerian professional basketball team based in Port Harcourt. Established in 2005 as Royal Hoopers, the team has won six Nigerian Premier League championships. They have participated in three BAL seasons, achieving a third-place finish in 2024."

name: Stade Malien
description: "A Malian basketball team based in Bamako, part of a multi-sports club founded in 1960. The club is highly decorated in Mali, with a record 19 league titles and 25 Malian Cups. They finished in third place in the 2023 BAL season."

name: US Monastir
description: "A Tunisian professional basketball club based in Monastir, established in 1959. US Monastir is a dominant force in Tunisian basketball, with nine national league titles. They won the 2022 BAL championship and were runners-up in the inaugural 2021 season."

name: Zamalek
description: "A professional basketball club based in Giza, Egypt, part of the Zamalek SC multi-sports club. Founded in 1937, the team is one of Egypt's most successful, with 18 national league championships. Zamalek won the inaugural Basketball Africa League (BAL) championship in 2021."

name: AS Douanes
description: "A Senegalese basketball club from Dakar, founded in 1980 as the basketball section of the national customs agency. AS Douanes is the most decorated club in Senegal with 11 national championships. They were the runners-up of the 2023 BAL season."

name: Patriots BBC
description: "A professional basketball club based in Kigali, Rwanda, founded in 2014. The team has won four Rwanda Basketball League championships. The Patriots gained international attention in 2021 when American rapper J. Cole played for the team in the inaugural BAL season, where they finished in fourth place."
